Class GameGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameGUI

  • public class GameGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    GameGUI contains the main GUI of BattleZone. At the center of the GUI is the gameboard and to the right of it is a panel that helps display what turn it is and characteristics of the pieces. Also includes a Menu Item Bar which allows the user to reset or exit the game, toggle whether to show attack range when hovering the mouse over a piece, and skipping a turn.
    Version:
    May 28, 2019
    Author:
    Matthew Wang and Ajeet Kotturu, Period: 4th, Assignment: APCSFinalProject, Sources: Software & Architecture Design (Youtube User)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GameGUI.TurnDecider
      Creates a object that determines the current turn of the board game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameGUI()
      Creates the GameGUI from the parts created in the methods and private classes.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameGUI

        public GameGUI()
        Creates the GameGUI from the parts created in the methods and private classes. The GUI utilizes a BorderLayout from JFrame. Also creates, sets up, and displays the Menu Bar. Calls fillGameBoard() from GameBoard to initialize the 2D array. Adds BoardDisplay to the middle of the BorderLayout and puts the movesPanel on the East side. Creates a new TurnDecider, starting at the first turn.
